events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the highway involving their vehicle. Claim was filed to initiate the process for coverage.
The claim was categorized under auto accidents after reviewing the initial report and confirming keywords related to vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and communicate with the customer to gather further information.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
Requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with investigation.
Customer successfully submitted all required documents including photos and police report for the vehicle accident claim.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted third parties to validate the accident details.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the accident details match the claim submitted and coverage is applicable.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the vehicle repair costs as per policy terms.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved after customer acceptance of the settlement offer and confirmation from the investigation team.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover the vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was closed successfully following completion of payment and confirmation from the customer regarding repair progress.
